step1.sentence: When her brother needed help after losing his job, she didn't hesitate—blood is thicker than water, and family always comes first.

step2.story: Marcus had a falling out with his cousin years ago over a minor dispute, but when his cousin was hospitalized, Marcus drove through the night to be at his side. Their old friends were surprised, but Marcus just shrugged and said, 'Blood is thicker than water.' Some bonds don't break no matter what.

step3.story: Priya and her sister hadn't spoken in two years after a bitter argument about their parents' estate. Priya had thrown herself into work, convincing herself she was better off without the drama. Then one autumn evening, she got a call that her sister had been in a car accident. Without a second thought, Priya dropped everything and rushed to the hospital. Sitting in the waiting room, she realized how quickly all the resentment had melted away. Whatever had divided them, blood is thicker than water—and no inheritance was worth losing the only sister she had.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 피는 물보다 진하다는 것을 말 그대로 표현한 문장입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 가족 간의 유대가 친구나 다른 인간관계보다 더 강하고 중요하다는 뜻으로 사용됩니다. 갈등이 있더라도 결국 가족이 우선이라는 상황에서 자주 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 중세 독일어 및 영어 문헌에서 유래한 표현으로, 12세기경부터 기록이 남아 있습니다. 원래는 전장에서 함께 피를 흘린 전우의 유대가 가장 강하다는 의미였으나, 시간이 지나며 가족 간의 결속을 뜻하는 표현으로 굳어졌습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 가족 간의 갈등이나 소원함을 딛고 서로 돕는 상황에서 주로 쓰이며, 감정적이고 진지한 뉘앙스를 띱니다. 때로는 외부인보다 가족을 편드는 행동을 정당화할 때도 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He lent his brother money despite their past arguments because blood is thicker than water.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 과거의 다툼에도 불구하고 남동생에게 돈을 빌려줬는데, 피는 물보다 진하기 때문이다.
